protocol_name: Euplotes crassus transfection through microinjection into the macronucleus
protocol_name_html: Euplotes crassus transfection through microinjection into the macronucleus
affiliation: University of Bern, Institute of Biology

groups.group_name: Protist Research to Optimize Tools in Genetics (PROT-G)

components.data: Dilute 1:10 Euplotes crassus cultures of two different mating types in artificial sea water (20 ml tot volume for each mating type) and feed them with E.coli (3 ml for each mating type). Before to add E.coli to the Euplotes crassus cells, pellet them and wash them once with ddH2O (for bacteria preparation see protocol 'Culturing Euplotes crassus to high densities using E. coli as the only food source').
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dilute 1:10 Euplotes crassus cultures of two different mating types in artificial sea water (20 ml tot volume for each mating type) and feed them with E.coli (3 ml for each mating type). Before to add E.coli to the Euplotes crassus cells, pellet them and wash them once with ddH2O (for bacteria preparation see protocol 'Culturing Euplotes crassus to high densities using E. coli as the only food source').

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of Euplotes crassus transformation through microinjection into the macronucleus
source_data.protocol_name: Euplotes crassus transfection through microinjection into the macronucleus
source_data.protocol_name_html: Euplotes crassus transfection through microinjection into the macronucleus
source_data.annotation:
Recipe for complete seawater (1 L):

36 g Reef Crystals
1 ml Walne's solution
1 ml of 10 μg/ml FeSO4

0.2 ml of 2 mg/ml thiamine (light sensîtive; store at 4ºC)
Add distilled water up to 1 L
source_data.thread_text:
Recipe for complete seawater (1 L):

36 g Reef Crystals
1 ml Walne's solution
1 ml of 10 μg/ml FeSO4

0.2 ml of 2 mg/ml thiamine (light sensîtive; store at 4ºC)
Add distilled water up to 1 L
source_data.body:
Recipe for complete seawater (1 L):

36 g Reef Crystals
1 ml Walne's solution
1 ml of 10 μg/ml FeSO4

0.2 ml of 2 mg/ml thiamine (light sensîtive; store at 4ºC)
Add distilled water up to 1 L
source_data.affiliation: University of Bern, Institute of Biology

components.data: Grow cells at 24ºC for 4 days with a 12h light/12h dark cycle even without areation and then mix the two mating types at room temperature (the optimal cell density for conjugation is ∼1000 cells/ml and the volume <2.5 cm in high).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Grow cells at 24ºC for 4 days with a 12h light/12h dark cycle even without areation and then mix the two mating types at room temperature (the optimal cell density for conjugation is ∼1000 cells/ml and the volume <2.5 cm in high).

components.data: Isolate single Euplotes crassus cells with a donut shape after 2 days into artificial sea water with2% BSA in order to prepare drops for microinjection (ideally one cell each drop).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Isolate single Euplotes crassus cells with a donut shape after 2 days into artificial sea water with2% BSA in order to prepare drops for microinjection (ideally one cell each drop).

components.data: When drops are ready cover them with a layer of Mineral Oil to not let them evaporate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: When drops are ready cover them with a layer of Mineral Oil to not let them evaporate.

components.data: Inject into the macronucleus DNA in the concentration of 3 to 5 μg/μl using Eppendorf Femtotips I injection needle.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Inject into the macronucleus DNA in the concentration of 3 to 5 μg/μl using Eppendorf Femtotips I injection needle.

components.data: Recover each cell individually in 500 μl of artificial sea water plus 0.25 μl of E.coli at 24ºC (for bacteria preparation see protocol 'Culturing Euplotes crassus to high densities using E. coli as the only food source').
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Recover each cell individually in 500 μl of artificial sea water plus 0.25 μl of E.coli at 24ºC (for bacteria preparation see protocol 'Culturing Euplotes crassus to high densities using E. coli as the only food source').
